message: Dear Bob, I am delighted to present you with our premium product, which I believe would significantly benefit your business. Given its high value to you, I propose an initial offer of $950,000. This price reflects not only the product's quality but also the strategic advantage it offers to your operations. I look forward to your consideration and hope we can reach a mutually beneficial agreement.

Alice, your product is fantastic, but $950,000 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $850,000 for it. This price is still a good deal for you, as it's significantly more than what the product is worth to you. Let's work together to make this deal happen.

Thank you for your interest in our product, Bob. I appreciate your offer, but I must respectfully decline it. We value our product highly due to its unique features and exceptional quality. Considering this, I would like to propose an alternative offer of $900,000. This price aligns more closely with the perceived value of the product to us, while still being a fair deal for you. I hope we can continue our discussion towards reaching a satisfactory agreement.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down a bit, but $900,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go up to $875,000, which is a fair price for both of us.  This shows a significant commitment from my end, and I believe we can close this deal. Let's find common ground and make this work.

I understand your position, Bob, and I respect your willingness to meet halfway. After careful consideration, I am prepared to offer the product at $890,000. This price reflects a compromise that values the product's quality and your commitment to acquiring it. I believe this could be a win-win situation for both parties. I look forward to your response and hope we can move forward with this transaction.
